summary:
As a freelance consultant, I’m interested in research and consultancy assignments. I’m specialised in social sector development and public finance management. I have over twenty years of worldwide professional experience with social sector projects and programmes for a wide variety of donors. My consultancy experience concerns projects in all stages of the project cycle including programme design, project appraisals, due diligence, technical assistance and monitoring and evaluation missions. In my profile, you will find a number of projects that I have carried out.

I hold MSc degrees in Business Economics and Development Economics from the Erasmus University Rotterdam. As a senior economist, I’m particularly experienced with strategic planning and budgeting. I have provided technical assistance to several ministries in Africa, Asia and Central and Eastern Europe, I have developed enrolment and costing tools, and conducted several cost-benefit analyses for large infrastructural works in the health and education sector. Working in social sectors, I’m experienced with child-related policies such as universal access to education, mother and child health care, and programmes for children with special education needs. I have worked for clients such as the European Commission, World Bank, UN organisations, bilateral governments and NGOs. 

I have strong analytical and communication skills. I enjoy working in teams and I can work under tight deadlines. You can reach me via email: miriam.visser@blue-rc.com

projects:
[{'title': 'Development of a comprehensive Montenegro Education Sector Analysis', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'As Team Leader and Education Finance Specialist, supported the development of the Montenegro Education Sector Analysis (ESA). The ESA will provide an in-depth diagnosis of the education system in terms of equitable access, internal and external efficiency from early childhood education to higher education including a general and vocational stream. The ESA will serve to strengthen the education sector planning, implementation and monitoring capacities of the MoE in Montenegro, as part of a broader multisector reform of public institutions (UNICEF).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Etude du préscolaire au Maroc, Unicef Morocco', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'The aim of the study is to cost the scale-up of quality pre-school education to all 4-5-year-olds and design a financing strategy for it. Responsible for the design and development of a costing model and reporting on the results under different scenarios.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Review of the Education Capacity Development Partnership Fund - EUD Cambodia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'ROM review of this multi-donor education CDPF Phase III 2018-2023, administrated by UNICEF Cambodia. The aim of the CDPF is to strengthen the capacity of the education sector at national and sub-national level in terms of policy, planning, financing, human resources, inclusiveness and equity. The EU grant is the complementary TA component of the EU Budget Support to the education sector in Cambodia. The review had the objective of enhancing the EC accountability and management capacities with a strong focus on results and supporting the EU Delegation and Headquarter services by providing an external opinion on intervention implementation (remote review due to COVID-19)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Public Finance for Children, Budget Analysis Indonesia - UNICEF Indonesia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'UNICEF Indonesia in conjunction with the Ministry of Finance took the initiative and agreed to conduct the first ever budget analysis for children in Indonesia. By providing an insight in what share of the budget goes to children, the proposed analysis aims to inform policymakers on their public policy choices and estimated impact. A good understanding of children’s share of the budgets is a prerequisite for any analysis of allocative sufficiency, efficiency or equity. A similar understanding is also the basis for a discussion about opportunities to widen the fiscal space for increased spending on children.  The analysis is done with support of the University of Indonesia (LPEM) and two international consultants. Responsible for technical assistance and project management (remotely due to COVID-19). ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Review of Health and WASH services, return preparedness and capacity strengthening for refugees in the Thai-Myanmar border temporary shelters  - EUD Thailand', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'ROM review of this health project implemented by Malteser International and Handicap International in support of refugees from Myanmar along the Thai border region. The review had the objective of enhancing the EC accountability and management capacities with a strong focus on results and supporting the EU Delegation and Headquarter services by providing an external opinion on intervention implementation (remote review due to COVID-19)', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Solidaridad - Interim Donor Relations Manager', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': "Interim function. 
 
Solidaridad brings together supply chain actors and engages them in innovative solutions to improve production, supporting the transition to a sustainable and inclusive economy that maximizes the benefit for all. Solidaridad's projects aim to transform production practices in such a way that it provides fair and profitable business opportunities, guarantees decent working conditions and a living wage, and does not deplete landscapes where people thrive.

As Donor Relations Manager, I was responsible for: 
- managing and stewarding donor partnerships, and working together in close cooperation with the Solidaridad network to achieve agreed deliverables 
- monitor implementation and reporting to ensure that it meets plans, budget and quality standards agreed with the donor. 
- field visits to India and Ethiopia", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'A study on financing and governance of pre-primary education (PPE) in Croatia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Croatia has a 75.1% PPE attendance, the lowest in the EU. PPE attendance varies by locality in Croatia, and counties with the lowest attendance are also some of the least developed counties in the country. The kind of decentralised PPE arrangement that exists in Croatia is a contributing factor to low attendance in pre-primary education in specific localities, particularly those that do not invest in it. Nevertheless, this has not turned into action on the local level, because communities are either unwilling or unable to offer structured learning for pre-primary children. This is a matter of concern, since unequal spending leads to unequal opportunities to attend pre-primary education across the country. The goal of this study is to generate data for a more comprehensive insight into the barriers and bottlenecks for structured pre-primary learning in Croatia in order to understand how best to achieve an increase in access to PPE in Croatia. Conceptually, the study will be oriented on understanding the links between governance, costs and financing models. 
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'External Review of the independent evaluation function of the European Investment Bank Group', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'The External Review, initiated by the Inspectorate General of the EIB, serves as a means to see if and how the EIB Group, as a multilateral organisation, is working in accordance with relevant standards and benchmarks.  The review assessed to what extent the independent evaluation function of the EIB (IG/EV) fulfils its dual mandate of accountability and learning in accordance with international standards on Independence, Credibility and Utility. Responsible for drafting the report and assisting the Review Panel comprising of (former) heads of evaluation from the World Bank, AsDB, Norad and UNESCO.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Technical support and guidance to selected country offices to produce budget analyses and influencing strategies to enhance UNICEF’s influence on PF4C in Europe and Central Asia Region (ECAR)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'As PFM expert for social sectors contributed to 1) the literature review; 2) mentoring and capacity building activities for six Unicef country offices (Albania, Moldova, Kosovo, Tajikistan, Ukraine and Macedonia) to assist with the development of their budget briefs for improved public finance for children (PF4C); 3) developing the budget brief guidelines for the health, education and social protection sector for the ECA country offices and 4) providing inputs to the reporting; lessons learned and recommendations.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Support to the MoGE and MOHE in the preparation of the Education Sector Strategic Plan 2017-2021, Zambia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'As education economist responsible for preparing the financial chapters of a situation analysis for all sub-sectors in the education sector in Zambia (ECE, primary, secondary, TVET, tertiary, special education). The analysis served as a baseline for the development of the new Education Sector Strategic Plan of the Ministry of General Education and the Ministry of Higher Education (DFID) In the second phase, responsible for a diagnostic research study on equity (gender, geographical disparities, special education needs, household income etc.) and for financial modelling and financial chapters of the ESSP (UNICEF).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Costing Analysis for the Camfed/MasterCard Foundation Scholars’ Programme in Ghana', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'Through this ten-year program, the MasterCard Foundation has committed to support 4,000 Scholars through Senior High School and 2,000 through tertiary education. After 5 years, a Mid-Term Review of the Programme was conducted. Responsible for a costing analysis to assess the relative costs and benefits of outputs and expected outcomes. The assessment is based on the Value for Money Guiding Framework and serves both accountability and managerial purposes. The first objective was to account for the performance to date and to arrive at an informed judgement about whether the results obtained are worth the inputs spent. The second objective was to provide essential managerial information to improve decision making and the future prospects for (VFM) performance. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Evaluation of Budget Support to Sierra Leone', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Multi-donor evaluation to provide evidence on the extent to which budget support in Sierra Leone has contributed to sustainable results on growth and poverty reduction. Responsible for assessment of the impact of budget support to the health and education sector. (EU, DFID, AfDB, WB).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Evaluation of the Dutch Education Agenda for the BES islands (former Dutch Antilles)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Since October 10, 2010, Bonaire, St. Eustatius, and Saba have been island governments functioning as “special municipalities” within the Kingdom of the Netherlands. The schools in the Caribbean Netherlands therefore form part of the Dutch education system and the Minister of Education, Culture and Science is responsible for the Islands’ education policy. The ‘Education Agenda for the Dutch Caribbean: working together on quality” has been launched in 2010 to improve school performance with the objective that pupils will have the opportunity to gain a diploma that is of equivalent value to a diploma awarded in the European Netherlands. The evaluation measured progress made and provided inputs for an updated Education Agenda for the islands.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Mid-term review of the Partnership Programme between the Government of the Netherlands and the ILO', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'The Partnership Programme between the Netherlands and the International Labour Organisation (2014-2017) is composed of two phases of two years each. For the biennium 2014-2015, the Netherlands Ministry for Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation made a voluntary contribution of EUR 10 million of which 50% was allocated to the Better Work  Programme and the other 50% to the Regular Budgetary Supplementary Account (RBSA). Reviewed both programme components on progress made, the effectiveness of the funding modalities (earmarked and unearmarked) and the general cooperation with the ILO. The review served as an input for the Minister’s decision for funding phase II of the programme. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}, {'title': 'Technical Assistance Provider (TAP) to the Uttar Pradesh Health Systems Strengthening Project (UPHSSP) in India', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Technical Advisor of the Ecorys-led TAP project. Team Leader of the project during the inception phase. Different aid modalities were assessed and lessons learnt were identified and incorporated in the design of the EUR 12 million programme. The team produced the identification fiche including a logical framework with detailed activities and budget estimates as input for the formulation phase.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Miriam', 'last_name': 'Visser', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance consultant - Socio-economic development'}]}]
